messages.message:
Hey @Vasu I tried using the collection but i’m getting errors when uploading files to a new conversation. But if I upload the same file via the UI it works fine.

Below is a screenshot of the error, and my config in postman. Do you know what is happening here?
The API response when creating the conversation also says it succeeded, and there isn’t anything under the failure object.

@avi @Varun Jain @Bastiane we should consider if we are really ready to have customers test these APIs, if even Lee isn't able to easily get up and running! It may be best for us to pause sharing the API spec more broadly with customers until we are all confident that these work and are easy to follow

@Tom I just want to clarify that these are the Converse APIs. Let's have a few rounds of testing on this before making a go/nogo decision on we ship this as GA. 

The run app APIs are much more mature. A few customers have been able to use the spec sheet to get them up and running successfully. In addition, both Lee and I have done the same. We should be comfortable to share these with customers.
Thanks for the distinction @avi! Is there a specific process that determines once something is GA ready?
We have a potential customer that would be ready for testing of the Converse API once we're happy it'll work
I think it would also be helpful to know what instance of AI Hub I should be using. Prod, UAT or UAT-Internal as i get different issues depending on the deployment.

For run app APIs, let's use Prod. cc: @andy
For converse APIs, will defer to @Balaram and @Vasu.

Tom, re: the question about when we are ready for GA, I think that's the point where we are ready for _any_ user to build on the API. We should believe that the product is stable and will not cause breaking changes unless absolutely required.

During Private Preview, we open up the API to a select audience who we can support in a white-glove manner. It is ok to introduce breaking changes during this phase with clear communication. It's still important that we test the product ourselves before we give it to customers in this phase.

Once Lee is able to run the Converse APIs, it should at least be ready for private preview. The team working on the product (Balaram/Vasu/Varun) should take the call on whether it should go to GA
Very helpful, thanks @avi. Codifying the principles you have there into a 'GA checklist' etc. might be a useful way to help everyone understands where everything stands too

To validate the converse APIs, use UAT environment https://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com/

@Lee

Hey @Lee, I have a few questions to understand the issues that you are facing better:
1. What environment are you using?
2. From the screenshot, it isn't very clear, it seems the API returned successfully and you faced the error on the converse UI. Are both the conversations same on the UI and the the one you created using the create conversation endpoint?
3. Were you able to get the status of the conversation creation/processing using Get Conversation endpoint?
Adding a brief list of the steps to use the Converse APIs below:
1. Use the Create conversation endpoint to create the conversation (`/api/v2/aihub/converse/conversations`) and upload files to it.
2. Since, the above steps would upload the documents and trigger the processing for them in the background, we would need to check for the status of their processing using the Get Conversation (`/api/v2/aihub/converse/conversations/{conversation_id_from_the_previous_step}`) endpoint and keep polling it till the `state` shows `COMPLETE` . Once, the processing it done, the `documents` key would be populated with the successfully processed documents (name and document id).
3. Now, using the document ids produced in the previous step, one can ask any queries using the Ask a question (`/api/v2/aihub/converse/conversations/{conversation_id}/prompts`) endpoint.
Created a quick demo on how to use Converse APIs via Postman, adding the link here (https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ggcGNRzVp4sKRmhADtf6_QZdHxBXyCoC/view?usp=sharing) for reference.
